A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Filled with possibilities\, but rather abundant in clichés. Kylo\, the bad guy always-bad -guy formula just for the sake of maintaining the good vs. evil plot\, despite that himself found a beam of hope in his relationship with Rey.\nAnd also\, killing the old idols (Han Solo\, Luke) is not an outrageous idea\, I mean\, the actors are already in retirement age. But one thing is to follow the obvious decision and another very different thing is to do it in the laziest way possible. Why did they take the never-surrendering jedi that Luke Skywalker personified and then  transform him into a remorseful figure? Remorse for what? For failing your student? For not understanding that he is bringing balance to the force as you once did? The Luke that we all love and care for would have fought back  the Dark side\, would have tried to turn his nephew back to the Ashla\, until his last breath.
